intro: Commelina melanorrhiza, commonly known as black-root commelina, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions of Asia. It belongs to the family Commelinaceae, which includes many ornamental and medicinal plants. The plant is characterized by its upright growth habit and striking blue-violet flowers that bloom in clusters. Its leaves are typically lance-shaped and have a smooth surface, while the roots are dark-colored, giving the plant its common name. Commelina melanorrhiza is often found in wetlands and along stream banks, where it thrives in moist, nutrient-rich soils.
